meanings.definition: A person chosen to represent or supervise a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The syndics of the club ensured everyone followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: The syndics met regularly to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent3: The syndics had a meeting, but no one showed up except for a curious cat.
meanings.sent4: The syndics were like the guardians of the organization, always watchful and protective.
meanings.sent5: The syndics were like the wise elders of the group, guiding others with their experience.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals appointed to manage or oversee a specific task or duty.
meanings.sent1: The syndics worked together to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The syndics were responsible for ensuring the event ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The syndics decided to have a team-building exercise to improve their coordination.
meanings.sent4: The syndics were the task force that tackled challenges head-on.
meanings.sent5: The syndics were like a well-oiled machine, each member playing a crucial role in the operation.
